US investigates whether Libyan attacks tied to 9/11

The Obama administration is probing whether the assault on the US consulate in Libya, which killed ambassador Chris Stevens (left) and three others, was timed to strike on Tuesday's anniversary. (AP, 5:43 p.m.)

What's new with the newest iPhone?

(Beck Diefenbach / Reuters)

Opinion | Farah Stockman

Who is to blame for the death of Chris Stevens?

The blame for the ambassador’s death should rest squarely with the mob who attacked the consulate. But shouldn’t those who incite violence also be held accountable?

Ryan campaigns for old job

Paul Ryan is engaged in a national campaign as Mitt Romney’s running mate, but he is also spending $2 million in ads to keep his Wisconsin congressional seat.
Opinion | Brian McGrory

The Patrick we’re missing

Deval Patrick has too rarely been the great and fearless governor that the nation saw last week at the DNC. Now is his chance to change that.

Two graduates give $60m to NU

The Northeastern dropouts, who went on to earn their degrees after encouragement from a mentoring professor, are teaming up to donate to the university.
Opinion | Jeff Jacoby

Higher-ed bubble will burst

There are signs everywhere that Americans no longer believe that a college degree is everything it has been cracked up to be.

State seeks tougher labor laws

Governor Patrick’s administration wants to strengthen enforcement against companies that use temporary agencies or contractors that flout tax and wage laws.

Nine Jewish cooks, many opinions

Fran Putnoi, a former president of Temple Israel of Boston, recently gathered a group of friends at the synagogue to share their favorite holiday memories.
